channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Nancy Mace slammed for 'I will say Kamala's name any way I want to' comment
item.description: ​​South Carolina Rep Nancy Mace faced the heat on social media after she insisted on mispronouncing Vice President Kamala Harris' name on a CNN panel. Nancy declined to condemn Donald Trump's racist attack on Kamala Harris saying that she did not hear what Trump said. The panel told her that at a convention of the Black journalists, Trump said Kamala Harris turned Black and doubted whether Kamala was Black or India.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Nancy Pelosi would have publicly trashed Joe Biden if ...'
item.description: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi reportedly threatened President Joe Biden that she would publicly trash him if Biden did not exit the presidential race. Though Pelosi maintained that she was not behind Biden's exit, reports now claim that when Biden contracted Covid recently, Pelosi sent an urgent message to the president. Citing four sources, Daily Mail reported that the threat was clear that Pelosi would publish 'brutal polling figures' to back up her attack.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Australia, US look to joint production of hypersonic missile, US lawmaker says
item.description: Australia and the US discussed joint production of hypersonic missiles to alleviate strain on American defence resources and enhance deterrence in the Indo-Pacific. The initiative aims to counteract China's advancements in hypersonic technology. The AUKUS alliance will facilitate advanced defence collaborations, including nuclear-powered submarines, heightening regional security measures and deterring Chinese aggression in the South China Sea.

item.title: Pakistan govt admits tinkering with internet: Report
item.description: The Pakistan government confirmed upgrading its web management system to address cyber security threats, amidst ongoing internet disruptions. Millions faced connectivity issues, primarily with mobile data. Minister Shaza Fatima Khawaja emphasized the necessity of these measures for protection against cyber attacks. The disruptions led to a petition in Lahore High Court seeking immediate restoration of internet access.

item.title: 'It's scary': Israeli frontline city in dark over port blast risks
item.description: Residents of Haifa, Israel are increasingly worried about nearby oil storage tanks after Hezbollah revealed the site as a target. Although some tanks have been emptied for security reasons, residents remain fearful and uninformed about the potential risks. Past efforts to relocate the industrial area have largely failed, leaving the population in ongoing concern over possible attacks and environmental disasters.

item.title: Bangladesh student protesters plan new party to cement their revolution
item.description: An interim government headed by Nobel Peace laureate Muhammad Yunus - which includes two student leaders in senior positions - now runs the country.

item.title: Virginia man's crash claims life of 16-month-old daughter
item.description: A Virginia Beach man abducted his three children after stabbing a woman and child, leading to a police chase that ended in a crash on Interstate 495 in Maryland. The crash resulted in the death of his 16-month-old daughter and injuries to his two sons and himself. Charges will be complicated due to crossing state lines.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump’s son Barron draws attention once again. This time with Slovenian accent video
item.description: Barron Trump, son of Donald and Melania Trump, gained internet attention during his father's election campaign. Born in 2006, Barron, now 18, is increasingly involved in politics. A viral video from 2010 shows a young Barron speaking with a Slovenian accent, highlighting his multilingual skills and close family interactions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mark Cuban accuses Musk of algorithm bias on X; Tesla CEO’s response? ‘He is a giant poop’
item.description: Shark Tank billionaire Mark Cuban accused Elon Musk of manipulating X's algorithm to favor right-leaning profiles, suggesting Musk's personal biases were influencing political discourse. After Cuban's comments on The Daily Show, Musk defended X's open-source algorithm, attributing the content to user interactions. The exchange escalated, with Musk making a personal jab at Cuban, furthering their ongoing public disagreements.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: World on brink of third world war: Russian MP Mikhail Sheremet
item.description: A Russian parliamentary deputy stated that the world was on the edge of a third world war due to Ukraine's incursion into Russia’s Kursk region. He highlighted the involvement of Western military equipment and foreign participation. Meanwhile, North Korea expressed support for Russia, amid allegations of China, Iran, and North Korea aiding Russia's war efforts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan: Nawaz Sharif urges govt to address soaring electricity bills issue
item.description: Nawaz Sharif directed Shehbaz Sharif and Maryam Nawaz to collaborate in addressing rising electricity bills, which is vital for the PML-N's revival. During a party meeting, he emphasized reducing electricity prices and reactivating the party. The meeting also discussed local body elections and restoring previous local body laws, criticizing the PTI government for inflation and high bills.

item.title: Flights and trains cancelled in Tokyo as 'very strong' typhoon approaches Japan's Pacific coast
item.description: A strong typhoon hit Japan's Pacific coast, causing widespread transportation disruption and power outages. With winds up to 216 kph, Typhoon Ampil led to flight and train cancellations impacting thousands, particularly in the Tokyo area. Meteorological agencies warned of severe weather, including storms and flooding. The event coincided with Japan's busy 'obon' holiday week.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump claims Biden 'hates' Obama and 'crazy' Pelosi more than him
item.description: Former President Donald Trump accused President Joe Biden of having more resentment toward Barack Obama and Nancy Pelosi than toward him. Trump cited Biden's relegation to a less significant speaking slot at the Democratic National Convention as evidence. Trump also claimed that Kamala Harris is distancing herself from Biden, suggesting internal tensions within the Democratic Party.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Online outcry over China’s bid to spur marriage, hamper divorce
item.description: China's proposed changes to marriage and divorce regulations, including easing marriage registration but adding a 30-day cooling-off period for divorces, drew significant backlash. While the measures aimed to promote 'marital freedom,' the public expressed concerns about bigamy and questioned the right to a swift divorce. The Ministry of Civil Affairs is seeking comments on these revisions until September 11.

item.title: US elections: Is Trump’s eyebrow really 'falling off'? Zoomed-in photo from North Carolina rally leads to jokes
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Saudi Crown Prince is worried about assassination
item.description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman expressed concerns about his safety if he proceeded with a deal with Israel without securing concessions for Palestinians. Despite these fears, he remains committed to the deal. The agreement includes the US security guarantees and a civilian nuclear program. However, Israel is hesitant to include a clear path to Palestinian statehood.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: San Francisco sues AI deepfake pornography sites
item.description: San Francisco's chief deputy city attorney, Yvonne Meré, filed a lawsuit against 16 websites that create deepfake pornography by undressing women and girls in photos without consent. The lawsuit seeks to shut down these sites, citing violations of state and federal laws. This unprecedented legal action highlights the severe risks these websites pose to victims' mental health and reputations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: A disappearing President steps back into the limelight
item.description: President Biden made his first onstage appearance with Vice President Kamala Harris since withdrawing from the presidential race. During the Maryland event, Biden downplayed his resignation while focusing his remarks on former President Trump. With Harris now at the forefront, Biden’s remaining presidency sees a shift in roles, paving the way for Harris’s campaign efforts.

item.title: Fact-check: Trump takes aim at Biden, Harris, and Walz — But do his claims hold up?
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US unemployment benefits applications decline for second week
item.description: Applications for US unemployment benefits dropped for a second consecutive week, reaching the lowest level since early July. Initial claims fell by 7,000 to 227,000, signaling a moderate job market despite recent hiring pullbacks. Meanwhile, continuing claims also saw a decline to 1.86 million, and US retail sales surged in July, largely driven by a rebound in car sales.
